content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												Villagers and Heroes is a classic MMORPG that has been compared to the likes of Runescape and WoW. While I feel that a direct comparison to these games is less than accurate, I would go so far as to say that players from these other titles will find it an easy transition in terms of game play and mechanics. If you have not played these other titles, you will find that the base mechanics of game play are not that difficult to pick up on, thanks in large part to the games opening quest which serves double duty as a well crafted tutorial. While the game offers many of the traditional aspects found in other games of this genre, it has an acceptable learning curve. The main thing that differentiates this game from those previously mentioned is that it is more casual than hardcore, which results in a friendlier community than the average game of this nature.Like many other games in the fantasy genre, V&H has a medieval setting in which characters engage in three related aspects of game play. Combat and exploration, gathering, and crafting. There is an additional element of game play with the inclusion of villages. Characters can join join a stand alone or guild village where they maintain a house which grants additional storage, raise crops in their own gardens, and maintain a small ranch which yields components useful for crafting.Despite being squarely in the middle of a somewhat crowded genre, V&H offers a few aspects that make it somewhat unique. The most unique aspect in my mind is an add on to crafting referred to as the Gnog station. Through gnoging, a character can take existing gear and modify its looks and aspects. They can add and remove the various feats and abilities inherent to gear to create custom gear tailored to the individual needs of the character. Another feature that was added just this past year is the ability for a character to be "Reborn" which allows them to reset their combat stats and advance their character with bonuses, without the loss of non-combat achievements. My most favorite aspect of the game however does not have so much to do with the game itself as it does the games community. The owners and staff at Mad Otter Games have a reputation for being receptive to their customers, which results in player driven development. In actual game play, a player will find the game itself to be well moderated, which results in a play environment remarkably free of Trolls and Drama-llamas. Of all the on-line games I have played, Villagers and Heroes has perhaps the most friendly and welcoming community that I have ever encountered.Read more: http://mm-mysticalts.proboards.com/thread/270/villagers-heroes-revised-01-2016#ixzz3wfpDGkPC ~LL*Notes: (1) I played this game for over a year before making a Steam account for it. My client account is my primary account. My hours on record as a Steam player are less than a tenth (at best) of the actual hours I have put into this game. Just saying............ :P(2) Several updates and improvements to this game since the mid point of 2015 have prompted me to revise my original review. Any review you read for this game made prior to June of 2015 need to take into account the ongoing devolpment it has recieved since that time.

content:
Posted: April 19, 2014
												Villagers and Heroes isn't exactly your typical MMO...It has taken the crafting and gathering thing to a whole new level of not enough inventory space as well as focused the entire game around crafting and gathering with a hint of PvE. The PvE side exists (I'm still low level) but it's like the crafting and gathering is the main point of the game and the monsters are like a side quest which is pretty weird to say.The list:Graphics - Cartoony graphics-ish. They're alright but don't expect RIFT quality.Gameplay - You mean gathering and crafting? Pretty dang repetitive.Combat System - It absolutely sucks. Probably why they avoided PvP? Is there even PvP in this game? No there isn't.Community - Very friendly and very helpful.Chat System - It really sucks. Should be replaced immediately...Achievements - Yes of course... and they give you gold as a reward for earning them (interesting).Voiceover quality - Meh - Some NPC's are great and some others are terrible or too loud/too quiet/bad voice acting.Grinding levels? - It appears it's going to be quite the grind to get everything from leveling/crafting/gathering to maximum.Auction house - Very meh. Lag? - No, not really.Kid friendly? - Absolutely. Have young ones and need to have them do something for awhile? Let them play this.Overall it's an alright game but wasn't what I was expecting.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2016
												When I played it the game seemed like a more cartoony version of WoW, except the cost model will kill your wallet.It has so many crafting recipies, and like 20 levels of each ingredient type, and there's many types... This means if you enjoy crafting you'll have a ton of options... Right? The promise of that is what got me into the game. Here's where your wallet suffers.You get 3 inventory bags, 1 vault slot, and 1 house slot for storage (once you rent the house). After that you have to pay hard $ to get crowns which let you buy extra storage space. You can barely fit all the levels of 2 ingredient types into 1 storage bag. So to be able to enjoy the tons of crafting, you have to spend money to unlock storage.This isn't a "Pay to accellerate your levelling up" model. It's a "pay or suffer insane difficulty as you have to sell items to make room for what you need at the moment because we don't give you a way to get enough space" model.Save yourself $ and hassle, try some other game. Plus there are still minor bugs in some quest lines and the big one where my key setting changes were never saved and required me to rebind after each exit/launch.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
												Villagers and Heroes is an amazing game, if you like RPG style; this is a game for you. It is based on fighting to level up and complete quests, these quests can be for different, there are quests for leveling up your hero, (Eg) your player. there are four main player types, Worrier, Wizard, Hunter and Preist.The Worrier is for heavy close combat fighting. Wizard is for distance, long ranged attacked but not great in close combat same with the Hunter(archer). Finally the priest, it is mainy used for healing but can fight as well. In the game you can go solo or join a party, once you join a party you dont have to stay in it, you can leave it when ever you want. If you are in the same area as some party members you get 50% of the exp they get from attacking a monster.As you have read already there are areas, in Villagers and Heroes there is loads you can explore you start on a island called Ethlos this is where you willl be given a main quest, you do not have to do the quests but it is recommended if you want to level up fast, also the main quest is only to help you level up when you first start and teach you the rules and the ways around the game. Once you have completed it your done with the main and can do side ones.You can also join a guild or a village these can help a lot as if you need something Eg (Ore) for smithing you guild or village has a vault where players can put equipment they dont need in it for others to have, the differents between a guild and a village is that you can join a village of the bat were a guild the leader has to accept you in the only way this is done is if the leader invites you. Once you are in one of these you can make a house as you go on in the game you will unlock new looks; their are many looks out there also you can farm and breed this is a good way to make money, Money is in copper, silver and gold. 100 copper = 1 silver and 100 silver = 1 gold. monsters drop around 8-15 copper so the best way is to farm or quest. You can also get money from doing achivements.If you realy want to get good stuff level up fast or get money fast you can do in game purcheses but i dont recommend this, but its your money.Im going to stop talking now as i will give away to much and this may stop people playing as they know most things about it.If you need help on the game or want tips or if you have any questions just add me and message me, i will try to answer back as soon as i canHope you start playing its a great game, you nevere know we might be able to fight together.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2016
												Updated review:Alright so I've had my ups and downs with this game, as with most MMOs I play. If you don't feel like reading the whole thing the short version is: This game isn't perfect, but I'd still recommend it as a free player.The good:-Nice story that is, although predictable at times, very in depth.-Skill customization. Can reset skills at any point in the game, giving freedom to try different builds without remaking characters.-Can be played free. Nothing in the cash shop could really break the game for free players. There are things in the item mall that make it easier to level and give very minimal (5%) buffs to stats. You could still dominate a premium player if you worked hard enough to get your character built. The membership gives you bonus exp and takes away the debuff you get from dying.-Bosses are fun and challenging, which promotes group play, but doesn't require it. Being someone that solos every possible thing I can on MMOs I love having the freedom to at least try to solo bosses. I can defeat most things alone, but still get my butt whooped by others. -There is an auction house, which is my favorite type of trade system. -The village system is pretty nice. There's a vault in the city to donate items into and other people in your village can take the items as they need (or want). -The crafting system is very in depth. There are a lot of different things to do, and everything works together. Also, you can do everything on one character.There's more than what I'm posting that you can make within the crafting systems but this is a general overview:Cooking (potions and food) Smithing (swords, maces, and heavier armor)Woodcrafting (bows and staves)Tailoring (light armor)Bug Lore (collecting bugs)Fishing (collecting fish)Plant Lore (collecting fruit, wood, and mushrooms)Mining (collecting ore)Gardening (growing plants in your village)Ranching (raising animals and collecting materials like fleece and eggs from them)The bad:-Everything is bound to you after using it, which makes an in game economy pretty much pointless.-The servers are a bit dead. It's hard to find other people playing that aren't either complete noobs or elitist trash. Then again, that's true for most MMORPGs.-Although the skills are customizable, the characters are pretty lacking in that. You can choose from a few hairs and faces, but all of them are pretty terrible looking.The meh (not problems for me, but might bother others):-The graphics are simple. I find this to be a good thing because it doesn't give me a headache after playing it for a long time like a lot of games these days do. It's not about being flashy and looking "pretty." It's not about having half naked girls running around like a lot of games. It's more about the story and gameplay than the flashy graphics. However, I know a lot of people prefer a game to be super pretty when playing it. If you're into that, you'll probably want to keep looking.-Skills are not just built from skill points. The armor/weapons you use determine your skill levels. This can be good because you can get high-ish level skills earlier than you would be able to normally. This can be bad if your items have skills that are good but stats that suck. Gnaugmentation (or whatever it's called) helps solve that problem, though. You can fuse items together and decide which appearance, stats, and skills you want to keep from either item. It's cheap (in game currency) and helps provide in depth customization.-Not much character balance. Mages seem to be very nuke-ish. They get a skill called "spirit orb" that can pretty much one hit ko anything their level except bosses, which it deals damage to more than 90% damage to early on. I'm playing a mage, so I don't mind, but I would like it if the other classes had a nuke skill or if mages were a bit more balanced. They have like 0 defense so I guess that makes it a bit better, but still.. one shotting things gets dull after a while. They're glass cannons, I suppose.This is what I've learned from the game within less than 15 levels (I think the cap is around 70, not sure). As you can see, the game has a lot to it.My personal issues with the game:The company seems to be one of those companies that does not care about the players, at all. It takes days, sometimes weeks to respond to tickets. Also, there was an item on sale in the cash shop. I purchased the item, and later got banned for it. They said that it was glitched and me purchasing the item was exploiting the glitch. It was very, very obvious that the item was put on sale and they just didn't think it through. I'm over it, and I still play the game, but they lost me as a paying customer with that one. You don't need to pay to play this game, so I intend to keep playing and not giving them another dollar of my money. They don't deserve it.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												Is it fun? Sure, it is an RPG with crafting elements. I would relate it to Runescape but the only real similarity is leveling various skills. As far as crafting gos you may as well spend some money on the game, as soon as you hit level 16 in any crafting skill you are limited to how many items you can gather and how may items you can make. The "Villages" and I say that with quotes because you are going to want to join a Village with active members or you and maybe one other person are going to be doing anything, are a time sink and nothing more. You get extra crafting and  xp if you finally get enough people to help make a single building and extra gathering xp by bringing in outside materials and putting them in these bins that not only give you more of the item but give you only that certain type of item and more xp while doing so. The RPG element is meh on so many levels, to actually do anything you need Elder Gear that you practically HAVE to get a party together to take down the bosses that drop the mats however only a single person gets the item and unless you know everyone in your party and mutually agreed to farm for everyone you are not likely to get it. On the other hand gear plays a BIG part of how well you are going to do, they obviously add your attack and defense stat bonuses but they also add points to skills in various ways. In short play this with friends you know and know that are going to stick around and make a village with them, otherwise you will not get much done in the long run and you will  ultimately buy some premium items. Not exactly F2P but you can kind of manage.

I love to farm and craft, etc.  I could spend all day just farming and crafting and the next day go beat the living snot out of that Bounty Mob that killed me the other day.  In that respect, Its great.  Cons : Only problem is, the graphics are a 3/10 at best.  I have been spoiled by many games that are high demand video hogs.  So, this is more of a personal preferance.  Out of the few hours Ive played, The game window has closed 5 times with no warning at all.  Getting stuck in a wall was a pain.  Also the in game village building.... Is always full.  Almost impossible to start your own or settle in one already made.  There is in game purchases which make it slightly P2W, but its almost needed at times.  If your a crafter, the bag space you have is very limited.  IIRC its 2 16 slot bags.  Others you need to buy through in game purchases.Overall a 4/10.  The Runescape end of it keeps me playing mainly because I've been hankering for a nice MMO RPG to play thats not mainstream.  IT IS F2P at any rate.  Worth a try.

content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												Gave it thirty hours and here is what I've deduced.Five best qualities :- Quest lines are pretty well written, nice splash of humour here and there.- Customisation in the sense of being able to mix and match gear skills via "gnogmenting".- People are mostly friendly and quite helpful, but it is F2P so expect ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.- Bounties, achievments and rare mobs called "Zingaras" to complete/hunt. - Music. Even the song that sounds like a 5 year old playing a recorder is quite hypnotising.Five worst qualities :- Combat. Many a times i've been on the brink of death because it wouldn't target or attack.- Crafting is so mind numbingly dull I was close to painting a wall just to watch it dry.- The stupid energy in place when doing any gathering or crafting over lvl 16. - Customisation. Variety is the spice of life. This has no real variety.- COMBAT !! When it works, its as smooth as one would expect. But some times....Whilst there are many aspects that can be tweeked and improved on, currently it is a nice dose of light hearted, quirky monster stabbing fun. Fair enough the graphics are what many would consider as "outdated" but people play WoW no problem and that has always looked half♥♥♥♥♥

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 3, 2014
												Extremely relaxing fun filled f2p/mts mmo. Thoroughly enjoying it! Came home from work as a bundle of stress, my usual mmo's were more "work", so I browsed for something  a little more casual or relaxed and found this gem.  Anyone who played Wizardy 101 will recognize the graphics, soft cartoony, colorful, yet easy on the eyes. Also, a family friendly game for someone looking to play with their kids. Currently I have stepped out of the 'Heroes' part of the game and am fiddling with housing and crafting. Truly, I can't recommend this game enough for someone looking for a relaxing and fun mmo. Most beautiful part; the microtransactions store does NOT impare the gameplay for those who can't afford to use it. No roadblocks! I would also like to note, I read reviews from players prior to trying it out. Some had me a bit concerned, however it looks like the issues addressed in this reviews have been resolved. Combat is far more user friendly, no longer locked in place... can run and cast etc. Definitely will not be a "niche" game, very much a mainstream relaxing mmo with a ton of achievements and goals to aim for. Lastly yes there is raiding in high end (I have yet to experience it) and from the death notices I have seen there does appear to be some pvp elements (arenas perhaps?). I am still fairly new to the game, hooked. Let's see if it keeps my love for it!

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 9, 2014
												A really bad game. Maybe would be ok as a browser game but as a standalone - no way.Its called VILLAGERS and Heroes, it announces housing as one of its main features. Almost shocked me to find out that the houses cant be entered. Real Housing was around in mmos about 10 years ago, where you were able to upgrade, customize, add furniture, add crafting tools, invite friends - in games that didnt even mention housing as a feature. None of that is available here, houses are nothing more than storage.The collecting/gathering professions, a huge part of the game, begs you to use macro cheating. Best way to level is to turn on "auto collect", define a key to send left mouse button every 2-3 sec and go afk for a day or two.The graphics were ok maybe 10-15 years ago, i dont get how such thing can be released in 2014.The ui is ok at best, you have all or least most basic informations. Of course you cant change anything about them, Resize/Move? - Lol. Its ok as the game just isnt very complex and a detailed ui isnt needed.The Style is comic like, but rather childish, naiv, simple and less cute.It also has combat, well a main part of it is combat. You can kill stuff. Thats it. Works. But thats it, no great tactics, group play or whatever, not very dynamic or challenging.Hell, the game is so bad, absolutly not worth writing a single more

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 14, 2015
												Graphics (indie) 8 of 10Entertainment value 6 of 10Pay to Win: Yes (money speeds up leveling and gets more skills to play with)Pay to Play: No (no money needed to play the game)Stability 9 of 10 (only had a few minor issues nothing game breaking)Controls 10 of 10 (very easy to understand)This is everything I've been looking for in a game except the f2p pay shop crap.  You get to have a town.. you and many others build houses in this town. you get a farm that you planet, water and grow.  get a ranch for raising sheep/chickens and other things.  in your town you build all the crafting machines (and upgrade them), build the collecting stuff too... like mines/trees/fishing holes... and the material is stocked by using a few items from the real game (apple tree level 1 takes 20 red apples to fill it and then it contains 200 for you to harvest in your town (the apples you get from town can't be used to refill this)PROS: Can build your own town with all your friends (in a guild or not up to you!) Can craft weapons and armor Can play how you like.. wanna just do crafting and nothing else after the tutorial do it.. your friends can bring you 20       of any material (ore for example) load it into the towns ore supply and boom you can now mine 200 of that ore        type. Though it does have a real money shop, it does seem to not be required to playCONS: In game real money shop (no matter what this is never a plus in my book, even though this isn't required so it's in the      pro column also) Sockets, You get a handfull free that's it.. then it's pay or do without.. what are sockets? they are the attrib of your weapon that gives you your attack skills.. without them you have to pick do you want slow shot or poison shot or one of 5 other abilities you can only have 4 without them. Game is entertaining for bit but then becomes extremely time killing.. ex: at level 21 you need 120,000 xp to level a craft.  you only get 100 per tree (without any xp boosts, I'm getting 106 in town) so just to get to 22 in gathering you'd have to click a tree/bush/mushroom 1, 200 times. (good luck) PAY TO WIN - you can buy things with real money and speed up your leveling .. one guy hasn't bought much been playing 1200 hours and he's only level 54(out of 75) other people have paid for stuff and made it to 75 much faster.EDIT: 36 hours in .. completely bored .. there isn't a point no direction can't figure out what's the point.. crafting is good for a while but honestly there is no point cause the gear you find in the wild is better than anything you can craft.I keep this as a recommend because if  you like crafting and gathering games this one is pretty good for about 30 hours of entertainment .. which is more than I can say for most games I've paid $50+ for

content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												Gameplay:Very standard RPG questing gameplay. Lots of different levelable skills. (Bug Lore, Cooking, Fishing, etc)Graphics:I would give them a 7/10. (On very low graphics settings, lol the graphics settings go to very high (for better computers)) They are very in the middle of cartoony to real, but more on the cartoony side.Is this good for all ages:Yes it is! Go ahead and hop on with your kids! (If you are a adult)Combat:The combat is mediocre. It consists of a basic attack and a bunch of special attacks relying on "Spirit Points" (The combat system relies on clicking). There is only one basic attack, and it varies from what it is from class-to-class. (Archer shoots a arrow, Wizard casts a little ball thingy, warrior swings his sword, etc) While on the other hand there is a WHOLE TON of special attacks, and there is a big selection of weapons for all the classes.Is it Pay 2 Win:No. There is some elements you can pay for (Instant Ressurect (Revives you where you died at full health), Mass Crafting (Crafting a ton of stuff all at once), Extra inventory space (but there is a few places where you can store your extra stuff in the game without paying real money (a vault, a purchaseable house), etc)Rating:7.9/10

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												So this is my experience, it's a bit harsh but this game is just frustrating from the controls down to the usage of system resources.     Controls are terrible, couldn't stand to play the game much longer than an hour. The graphics aren't even that amazing and the use of system resources is horrible. I play every game out there on max settings and I was seeing massive framerate drops doing something as simple as turning my character, which brings me back to the terrible controls. Movement is slow, rotation sucks and the whole layout of the movement in this game is backwards. The character modeling is terrible and I had to restart the game oh...about 10 times because it crashed every time I tried to finish my character creation, once I got through the terrible character creation screen (Which is about 85% of my time spent on this game) I was met with the disgusting control mechanism, I spent an additional 10% of my time playing around with graphics settings hoping to baby jesus that somehow they control the ugliness of the modeling, once again was met with disappointment when the models got even more jagged and I could now see (in detail) how terrible their collision checking was for their AI. As I turned my character I was met with the terrible disappointment that for these sub-par graphics somehow I am going under 60 frames per second when I can run way more gorgeous MMO's on ultra quality without any issues. This game is a huge disappointment and I feel bad for anyone who wastes money on the in-game content, their global chat is next to dead which goes to show how many people don't want to play this game, because it's bad. I don't even care how many downvotes this gets me, because wow, just wow this game is so bad, please just stop developing this game because the team who handles your coding must still be in highschool. Uninstalling immediately and never looking back to this dark moment in my past. I am going to write this one off as a skeleton in my closet and I am genuinely a little disturbed that a game like this made its way onto the steam market.YOUR GAME IS BAD AND YOU SHOULD FEEL BAD.*Edit as of 11/26/15This game is still bad but I want to add that my specs are as follows:Windows 10 64bitIntel Core i7 5820k (6 physical cores 12 logical)16GB DDR4 SDRAM (2133MHz)NVIDIA GeForce 970 (3.5GB Dedicated VRAM)The reason for adding this is so you can all understand I have a machine that is capable of running just about any new release to date on maximum settings, 4K Resolution, etc. without a problem.Anyway don't play this game, because it's STILL bad, clearly the developers have not listened to anyone or have completely abandoned support for this game. Personally I can't blame them, I would abandon my ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ stepchild too.

number of helpful: 13 of 27 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
												Review Score: -4.5/10- As of Nov. 17, 2014. 'Lacks Visuals, Traveling a'Bore, Indecently Expensive'Comical Liner: 'I once had this game, it was very fun until it uninstalled itself, then I forgot the game existed..'Quick Summary; Before you slip past the scoreboard, I'd like to say.. If this game was specifically for a kid, I'd give it a 5.5 or possibly a 6. The game seems a bit... Underdeveloped. Sure it has it's "Greats" And "Heights" Such as many other games, but this game doesn't have anything to draw itself onto "Uniqueness" - And have something new to the table of MMOs. However, even despite this it can be pretty decent for someone with a lot of time... Otherwise, prepare to spend a lot of time traveling, and playing very carefully as potions derived/created/or bought ingame, are pretty faulty; Except the Paid by real money kind. Enjoy.Pros:- Game seems appropriate for a 'First time RPG'- The look and theme persisted- It had a WoW-like feel, a bit more cartoony.- Game is child friendly it seems as well, but that's about where it ends.- Crafting seems pretty fun. It's great that you can train any skillset.- Combining multi-items into better or more stylish items is neat.Cons:- Traveling across this game is tedious; Time-consuming and tedious.- Did I mention traveling in the game feels like a grind in itself?- If you died, while traveling, get ready to pay real money to revive..- Or pay money to travel to wherever you attempt to go.- Mana and health dies out pretty quickly, so stock Lots of garbage potions.- Reliable, usable, and good potions are only purchasable via Real Money.- Generic Quests. i.e. Collect 10 XYZ, Bring XYZ to XYZ, story driven? No.- Controls feel like it's still in Alpha, Keyboard and Mouse sometimes conflict.- Everything feels instanced, get ready to wait at every turn.- Music.. Is.... That's all I can say without violating terms of agreement.- Same generic sounds played for everything; NPC, Damage, Damage Taken, etc.- I don't recall anyway to "Speed up travels" meaning... Real money to Travel.- I was told by a friend you can have a house and XYZ, but it's just a "Stash"Ending Conclusion; Don't play it unless you really... Really.. Want too, or it's already there for your niece, nephew, son, daughter.. And just wanted to play it. Otherwise, steer away, your money is worthwhile in other Indies that aren't trying to squeeze your wallet.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												This game is a great MMO to play with your friends, and is still fun when you are alone. It is harder when you play alone, but I would still recommend it. I don't like the way the automatic combat system works, but most of the time you are using abilities, so I hardly ever notice. The game also has much gameplay with great crafting, wich can be tedious at times, but still is helpful. There are many places to go, and many, many quests to do, which increase with difficulty the higher level you are. This game also has TONS of gameplay, as long as you work on the quests for xp, which is nice so you don't have to grind. I have at least 35 hours of gameplay or something and I am only level 12 and not even CLOSE to finishing the game or quests, let alone explore all of the areas. There are also many bosses to track down and defeat, which also adds some purpose to the game. Everything eventually leads up to fighting a stone atmy with one of Mallok's apprentices or something, but I am nowhere near the end. I highly recommend this game, especially to play with friends.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												Okay, I am a big mmo guy. So i saw this game and started playing for a few hours, i saw it had some issues but I thought it had potential. I needed a game to play until wildstar came out at the end of May, so i gave this game a real shot. I REALLY tried to like this game. I even put a fair amount of money into it. This game is definately pay to win. If you dont spend at least 50 bucks upgrading your bags, vault storage, and infiniate travel runes you will not enjoy this game at any stage. Which is fine, I was willing to put up some money to see how its end game was. Bad idea. This game is limited to just running around a few zones at end game. The zone is basically the dungeon in which you have a few bosses to kill. Thats it. Thats the end game. No pvp at all. No real instanced dungeons. Forget about raiding. The zones are also very small when compared with other mmo's. Do yourself a favor and do not try this game out for yourself to see if its any good, I already tried that. Its not.My suggestion, if you want an mmo. Is to pre order wildstar. Ive put over 100 hours into it and its AMAZING. Great PVP, hard end game PVE raids/dungeons. Warplots (think guild wars 2 keeps but instead of defending your keep with arrow carts you defend it with missle guided lazer systems and raid bosses). Good luck guys.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
												Villagers and Heroes has fantastic concepts and ideas. I love the idea of city building with friends in an MMO setting. I was so excited to play this game. I mucked throught the first 45 minutes of wandering tutorials and rough quest dialogue with the light at the end of the tunnel of being able to make my own town with my friend. After beating the tutorial boss we were given the quest to begin the main quest line. NO MENTION OF HOW TO CREATE A TOWN. If that is the main focus of the game, instead of giving repetitive quests and gather missions (Which every MMO does) focus on the thing that makes Villagers and Heroes unique, city building sandbox MMORPG. That is what makes this game a fantastic idea; however, the developers fail to capitalize on the fantastic ideas, instead bogging the player down in childish graphics and incoherent quest line. I would be elated to return when the focus is MMORPG sandbox city gameplay as opposed to standard MMO gameplay.

That's about it.The game is pretty much PvE... Pretty boring.I thought it was going to be an Albion duplicate.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												Well, at the moment i have 10 hours on this game, and from first impression i really like the game, when you first start playing the game you feel very "Youthful" and for older players like myself its rather relaxing. The best part about the game was it was totally free! There is however a item shop in which you can purchase crowns, the items in the shop are somewhat fairly priced. The questing system is very simple, you basically do as you would in most MMORPG's and collect things for people, and beat up villans, grind, craft ect.. Learning the game is so easy.. like seriously.. so easy, even a 3 year old child could learn this game in less then 20 mins, which i find is rather nice as it lets you dive into the game right away and not waste 4 hours trying to figure out how to craft something. I've played various free to play games, and this is one of the top free to plays if you are looking for something that is simple and enoying. If your looking for something that complicated, detailed this is probably not the game for you.Now, the good things in this game is that is has guilds, housing, currency system, mail, trading, enchanting, cooking, fishing and the list goes on. The controls are not all that bad, but i would like to see control options for people that like action/combat controls and opposed to turn based controls, i understand this game is semi what turnbased in the way that it works in combat, but i think it should move over to a move of a hack and slash style, as it would feel much more action package.Now for the bad about this game;-Support is VERY slow to respond, there is currently an issue with their crown system and purchasing, emailed support still no response, been 24 hours, and its not really a big game- Launcher at the time of this review crashes every 30 mins, i have a feeling there is some type of memory leak thats causing this, there is a walkaround which you can find on their discussion forums, it worked for me and i know longer crash.- Some of the doors you have to click 5-6 times before they open- When you click on NPC's to automactically combat them you sometimes get stuck on items in your surroundings like trees and rocks, instead of your character going around the obsticle, your character just gets stuck.- Auction is DEAD.. no really enough players online to support a good auction house-UI could really use some work with things like showing your current rank, question direction indicator, better mapping system-Inventory system is a little lame, could use some work to make it look better, make even make it larger as it seems rather small for a dedicated playerWith all that being said, im still rather new into the game, and with updates this review may change, as may my opinion on the game, as it stands right now i would give this game the current ratingsEasability- 10/10Fun- 8/10Community- 5/10Gameplay- 8/10UI- 6/10Item mall prices- 8/10Support- 5/10Stability- 8/10Graphics- 7.5/10Overall - 7.5/10I would highly recommend downloading the game and playing it, its free to play and requires nothing but your time.

Posted: January 26, 2015
												The game even though lacks a bit of graphics has a great potential to maintain at top. Despite having low traffic channels it seems to me that people are bored to explore the game... everyone complaining about the Vim being inadequate..i say start your day with 20-25 bounties and the vim is enough (you get 40-50 more). A very good feature in the game is the village where simply...money talks bul!sh!t walks. Everyone would want his settlement to be one of the best in game but this comes to a very large price. Endless hours of farming to build the projects but you get rewarded as daily quests appear. Plus you have kitchen, smith, tailor in a convinient radius without searching every city.I personally enjoy this game very much. I would compare this to Aion but a lot more Gbs and graphics. Huge craft radius, lots of areas to explore but server balance is.... :S .I agree with you people saying that V&H is Free-to-Play/Pay-to-Win. It is funny though and enjoyable :)F@cking YES from me

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 23, 2014
												tldr: This game has the potential to be very enjoyable, but if you want to get the best expience out of it, be prepared for a bit of a cash sinkThe village system shows a lot of promise (if you can find yourself an active village) And it is nice to have your own house (even if it's just a nice looking item store) farm and animal pen. The community are also increadibly nice and it's one of the only MMOs I've played where I never encountered anyone trying to agro anyone.There is a uniquely high focus on item gathering and crafting which can be a selling point for some people, but like battle exp it becomes difficult to progress after level 10 without a lot of time put into grinding.The music can be very repetetive but is not terrible and there is a nice hand painted texture aesthetic to the world, which is also pretty huge and full of story quests, daily quests and weekly quests to keep you occupied. However the world being so large is also what breaks the game for me. While it is possible to teleport from place to place the items used to teleport you are premium items that are difficult and rare to find in game without buying them as extras, I get that as a free to play game they have to make their money somewhere, but for something so vital to the gameplay it seems like a bad direction. I would really like to reccomend this game because I did have a lot of fun initially with it, but with the combination of game vital premium items and a steep grinding curve after the first few levels I can't in good faith fully endorse it. Though it is free to play, so if you want to give it a chance it certainly wont cost you anything to see for yourself whether you can get more out of it than I did.

Posted: September 13, 2015
												TLDR: Over priced items and a game that doesn't operate properly.  Once you finish the newb Island and start tring to do quest in other areas the game falls apart, Unable to get quest (due to NPC not responding when targeted/mouse clicked), this also happens when you try to click a door.  The main disappoint for me is the over priced cash shop.  They make sure you'll need plently of bag and bank space and they charge you for it (20-60 dollars for bank and bag space is way to pricey) for a game that is at best worth 19 dollars.  I played two Characters to lvl 14ish and had fun till lvl 8ish when the flaws started to show.Would not recommend.

However the world being so large is also what breaks the game for me. While it is possible to teleport from place to place the items used to teleport you are premium items that are difficult and rare to find in game without buying them as extras, I get that as a free to play game they have to make their money somewhere, but for something so vital to the gameplay it seems like a bad direction. I would really like to reccomend this game because I did have a lot of fun initially with it, but with the combination of game vital premium items and a steep grinding curve after the first few levels I can't in good faith fully endorse it. Though it is free to play, so if you want to give it a chance it certainly wont cost you anything to see for yourself whether you can get more out of it than I did.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
												WOW! A really terrible game! It tries to feel like runescape. (If you've ever played it). Slow Framerate. Even at low settings. Atrociously Bad Combat. *Click* Thats all. Theres no need to use your skills. Buggy Gameplay and it gets even more confusing to manage after you spawn in. Your Presented with 20 different things. Horribly Voiced Characters. Lathargic movement. (Btw way terrible Moving system.) This game is dissapointing at the least. There are alot of word that can be used to describe how bad this game is. As a matter of fact. It had me laughing at how PATHETIC EVERYTHING IS!!!Nothing is special about this game. Its a waste of time. And computer Space. If you wanted better gameplay. Play Wizard101! Yeah thats right! I went there! Incredibly stupid Artificial Intelligence.The Quests are the worst part! To track it You press "J" to open up your quest journal. and hit track quest. And After you're presented with a HUGE Icon of the Quest's Icon PASTED onn the map. Not only that but the Quests are Ridiculously easy!Hunters are overpowered.And everything else is just... AAAAAAAAGGGGGGGGG!!!! TERRIBLE!!!! My short amount of time may have not given the game a chance. I'll take that.The screenshots look nothing like the actual game. Models Arent Smoooooth Like expected. They're Blocky and pixelated.Just... No more! 1/10. Misleading, Terrible And Stupid.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2014
												I recommend this game because it is similar to pirate101, wizard101, and School of Dragons. If you like any of those games you would love this! the music goes with the game, plenty of quests to do, and really hard bosses! Well not that hard, but still they can be pretty hard if you don't level up properly. I like how you get to mine, fish, farm, ect. to make certain stuff. I likethe graphics on this game. Very good community. However, only one person gets the quest if ur beating up a boss with a friend or some random person. It takes probs a minuet or so for the boss to respawn. The two servers i played on were pretty full just be aware of that. You can also pick from 4 different types of classes, knight, archer, priest, or wizard/mage.  Each class has a beginners, non-beginners, and advanced clothing looks.

content:
Posted: April 18, 2015
												Great if you want a casusal only log on every few days type of game. At the higher levels 16+ you have to rely on an ingame "stamina" system called Vim which makes what would be a ridiculously crafter friendly game into a wait until you have more stamina game. The battle mechanics seem to be about as basic as humanly possible so if you never wanted a hard battle system this is for you. Lag is what really tends to be a problem. Every 10-15 minutes like clockwork the interactions you have with things will just hang. click a door 4 times and it wont work until the game catches up and summarily opens and closes the door 4 times in front of you. now before people say it could be on my end I also have a high end gaming rig. I was looking for a crafter friendly kind of menial takes no thought game and this was it. The problems however make it not worth the effort.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												I DL'ed this as a test run for my world into pc gaming and quickly abandoned it. The game itself is NOT bad, however, that said it is about as flavorful as tofu. Some people dig tofu... many find it tasteless with a slightly rubbery, crumbly texture. That is this game. The fighting is good (if easy even for the newest of players I.e. myself), the objectives are fairly clear cut (retrieve this, craft this but gather all the items for it first, and oh btw please save us all... if you have the time.) I spent a decent amount of time fishing... yes in game fishing, and crafting what few new items I could for my character at that skill level. As a ftp you're not losing anything by giving it a go and I think it would be a great game for a younger audience or very new gamers. Overall I guess it's just like I said; not bad just not really interesting.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
												This game is  bad. It will never be up to par with any other MMO without going through major cleanups. Now, my play time with this game is low due to me having played this mostly on my laptop with another steam account, but here are the hard facts:The controls feel like you are running on wet ice with flat shoes. The graphics are heavily artstyled, but severely ugly (especially on the player characters). The AI is laughable. The first thing I saw was an enemy walking directly into a tree to no end. This game tries very hard not to be a WoW clone, and succeeds ever so slightly, but in the bad way. It is an unplayable mess, and if the developers want to ever make money (I assume that is their only reason for working within the gaming artform), they probably should make a more compelling game. There are many features that seem impressive, but at the very core of the game there are huge flaws. Fix it say I, I want another admirable MMO on the market. For now though, I'd advise any consumer to stick to WoW, as the new expansion is pretty wicked.From me it gets a 3/10 for possible potential.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 29
												Were you a big fan of runescape back in the day and looking for a similar exsoeraince? Try out Villages and Heroes. It is a f2p fantasy based mmorpg for mobile devices and PC. It has a focus on crafting, guilds, story and combat. You level up as you use your skills. It is run by a dedicated group of devolpers and has really nice fan base . It is well populated in the later areas of the game, not so much in the well designed starting island. If this game sound interesting to you try it out, you will not be disapointed. It can easily be played casually or hardcore. Play it once in a while for an hour or more or play it several times a month. However you play, I can personal guarantee you it will be time well spent.

												This game did not impress me. The graphics were reminiscent of Wizard 101 but less cutesy. The controls were slow and clunky, combat was point and click with clunky animations and the skills were lackluster and generic. The crafting gave me hope, but it was shot down when this more interactive process caused the game to crash multiple times. On a whole, at present time there are more MMOs out there that are free and do everything better. This game excels at nothing thus far and isn't worth sticking around for. 3/10

content:
Posted: October 23, 2015
												I wrote a big ol'review of the game on my blog but I thought I'd put the summary here on steam. If you want to read the full version you can find it here:  The Apathetic Gamer - Villagers and Heroes	[theapatheticgamer.com] The Basics	PositivesEnjoyable art and writingLarge crafting and gathering systemUseful player houses and villagesNegativesObject collision issues.To many base materials that can’t be sold.Clunky auction house.Poor inventory controlsWhen it comes down to it Villagers and Heroes is a  niche game that speaks to people who like to craft. Considering the game was made by a small indie studio the game is rather good. While it is playable and enjoyable there is still a lot of refining that I believe needs to be done. If the premise of Villagers and Heroes interests you then you owe it to yourself to give the game a try.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												I played this game a couple of months ago before I wrote this review. What I remember from my experience of playing this game is this. While I enjoyed the content that this game had to offer, or at least the content until the first city where I collect wool to tailor myself a piece of clothing, what I didn't enjoy was the combat system. My combat playstyle is usually hit-and-run and AOE spells. In this game, while I couls successfully execute AOE spells, I wasn't able to 'hit-and-run' since if I moved after I ordered a basic attack but before my character actually executes it, my character never executes it. I'd recommend this game for what it has to offer, but the combat system could benefit from some polishing up.

number of helpful: 7 of 16 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
- The Good> The fighting system is good and made comfortable, a mix of of WoW and RuneScape.> Crafting is simple and fun, you can easily make necessary armors/weapons already at the beginning of the game.> There is lot to do due to various "jobs".> Game world affects interesting and there is much to see.> You can make own house in game. But however, this costs real money. The idea seems funny for those who got money to use.- The Bad> Music in game is repeating itself all the time. This wouldn't interfere if it wasn't "bombastic" fantasy mud.> The missions are sometimes messy. Where do you find this chicken? Where you need to deliver that feather?> Combat is sometimes stiff, example you cant move while you are attacking.> You only get two bags on start, if you want more space you need pay real money.> Game sometimes crashes without reason.GAMEPLAY - 90%GRAPHICS - 70%MUSIC - 50%-In short, this game is very childish. Bright colors used everywhere and graphics are cartoonish.Fighting in this  game is not challenging and is only clicking buttons. Missions follows the same pattern as in the other MMO Games: (Kill chicken, take feather, give it to that person etc.)Anything in the game doesn't seem hard or different.Is that a bad thing? Not necessarily.In my opinion this reminds me RuneScape -game, that you can play without further tense and madly screaming.This is game for those who wants something very simple, or those who aren't ready to pay World of Warcraft's monthly fees.-Total score: 7.9

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												Disappointment and Disjointed.These words best describe a game that had some grand ideas, yet simply failed to deliver. The key draw of this game, of course, is that it combined WoW-ish gameplay, with UO-ish housing and crafting. Unfortunately, it simply doesn't deliver on either.The graphics, to start with, are low quality as they can get. The coding for the game is obviously not optimized, as even on normal settings, I found myself with only 38 - 40 FPS, on a rig  that can run crysis 2 on max settings, and still get 50 FPS, and skyrim, well, we won't even talk about how great the framerate on that is, even with max settings and numerous graphical improvement mods. Graphics, however, are forgivable, if the gameplay is good. Ultima Online stood on this for years, because of the depth of the crafting system, and the housing system.Stability was also an issue, at first. For the first two hours, my game kept constantly, and randomly, crashing to desktop without any notice or erorr messages, every two or three minutes, while I was trying to craft things. My guess? I probably clicked a button too fast, and the game's code took offense at it.One thing that this game -does- do well, is that a good chunk of materials can also be gathered by killing monsters, tying the crafting sections in with the combat sections and, if they had imposed some type of skill cap limit, would have made fighters every bit as valuable to a village, as the villagers themselves. Of course, the draw of the game is that you can decide to either be a villager, or adventurer. In truth, you're simply an adventurer that sometimes dapples in villager-lite actions.I was extremely excited when I finally got the chance to build my own home and enter a village, even so much that I just went to a random, newly-created town, and built it there. I was intrigued at first, that you had to actually stockpile a specific amount of resources at each node, to activate it. This quickly turned to disappointment, when I found out that, while you only need to gather 30 - 50 of the resource to stock the node, this stock depleted. Indeed, stocking the node with 30 of an item, seemed to give it 182 charges to gather from, before you'd have to restock the bin again. Which is actually pretty great.Except that you cannot restock the bin with resources gathered in that village, and you can only gather from your own village. This basically means that there is no purpose to loading a resource node up with any resources, unless you plan on tripling the resource and then immediately camping it to boost your own investment (Otherwise someone else can just steal it from you), or unless you want to use it to power-level the gathering skills of new players in relative safety.Instead, you're just simply better off going to a random zone, and gathering at one of the nodes that never disappears. The game also claims that you can only gather so much in a day, due to an energy bar limit, but I did not encounter this at all in four hours of gathering, though it would also be another dermit, if I had.Housing has to be great, however, right?Wrong. Unlike UO, you cannot enter your house. Instead, the house gives you bonuses to specific parts of your adventurering.. but there's a catch. It costs a lot of gold for even the first bonus. Twenty-thousand gold, to be exact. The other bonuses are even more signifcantly difficult to get, requiring rare items, for very small bonuses. Then there is your little farm plot and animal pen. My sheep went to sleep within five minutes, and I couldn't even interact with him for three hours afterwards, so I can't say too much on that process, other than the fact that I couldn't add any more sheep, because my sheep passed out and I couldn't tend to him to increase my skill.Then there's the farming. In most games, you plant some seeds, you harvest them, you get back at least 2 seeds and some crops. In this game, you plant some seeds, you harvest them, you get one crop per seed planted, which, if you get enough skill, you can re-plant once. With level 4 farming, I couldn't even re-plant the level 1 wheat crop I harvested. In the end, it's another situation of something that seemed like a great idea, but was destroyed by bad design choices.So what's the verdict, then? Do you play it, or do you not?Well, if you're a fan of runescape-ish games, have a lot of free time, and are a farmville fan, this game would probably suit you just fine. The cash shop, at least, isn't completely in your face, and while I could see storage issues (Which are solved by the cash shop, at not too horrible prices, at least) cropping up at later levels of the game, after gathering and hording everything for four hours, I had no problem with it.If you're looking for something that lets you decorate a home, really give you ownership of your village, and generally reward you for investing in the village, you'll be sorely disappointed, and I suggest you simply pass this one on.The developers, for what it's worth, seem to be fairly active on the steam forums, and seem to genuinely want to make a great game. Perhaps, in the future, they will take feedback and process it. With the right alterations, and the proper polish, this game could easily become a diamond, at this stage, however, it is a decidely rough cut.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2014
												For those of you who may be fans of Villagers and Heroes, I offer my apology in advance. I'm not trolling. So please hear me out. According to the System Requirements listed below, it reads:Originally posted by author:RECOMMENDED: OS: Windows® 8, 7, Vista, or XP Processor: Intel® Core 2 Duo 2.2GHz, AMD Athlon™ 64 X2 2.6GHz or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Graphics card with 512 MB of memory or more DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Hard Drive: 3 GB available spaceNow, I am using an HP Pavillion dv7 running Windows 7, with 8GB of RAM, an Intel Core i7 Processor, and an ATI Radeon 6770M dedicated video card. In spite of this, Villagers and Heroes struggles to perform on even the lowest graphics settings. Why is this a problem when I am exceeding the system recommendations?Taking into consideration that I can run other MMOs like Dungeons & Dragons Online, Star Wars: The Old Republic and World of Warcraft at 1600 x 900 with the graphics settings at medium with no problem, there should not be performance issues. But for me, Villagers and Heroes is somehow unplayable.- even though the game is supposedly running at 20fps, it looks like 1 frame for every 2 seconds- Mouse responsiveness is painfully slow- game freezes at character creation- no soundUnless you have money to burn, or a monster gaming rig with an nVidia Titan, save yourself the trouble. Don't download it.

												Feels like a baby runescape. Still half decent, not pay to win which is absolutely beautiful.But the ♥♥♥♥ing combat HOLY♥♥♥♥♥♥ The combat doesn't seem like an important part of the game initially, but you get thrusted into it just to keep any interesting things in the game. Why the combat is♥♥♥♥♥♥br>1. It is click and wait to fire. Terrible lag makes this cringeworthy2. Combat levels up like any other skill, but extremely slower than the others. This means the experience ratio compared to say fishing, is way off. Level 1 spot for fishing could get you to about level 10 easy in a bit, getting level 10 in combat takes about 6x that length off level 1 enemies.3. The abilities run off of high costs so you can't spam if you're a wizard, so you have to wait to go into another fight.Advice for combat:1. Instead of point>click>wait, have the mouse as an aim and you can fire off of that, in range of course.2. Better servers3. Change the exp ratios But this game is good, the combat brings it down to a no.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2015
												This is gonna be a long, in-depth review. While I give it the thumbs up, I do so with a grain of salt, and a very big grain of salt.But for those of you with TL;DR Syndrom, here is a short summary:  The game has graphics that look bad today, but has a good, nostalgia feel, while also giving a nice digital world look. Its a basic and standard MMO, but lacking in some content specifically, content found in other MMOs.So, to begin with, Im into MMOs. Personally, I am interested in a social MMO, with different aspects to play. Namely, housing, PvE-content, socializing among the community, dungeon runs, RP especially like a knight (like, wearing knights armour, sword, shield, horse) and some PvPing. Yes, I'm aware VnH does not have PvP, but more on that later.So, really, once you see the game world, and the store page, you'd think this game is just what I'm looking for, right? First off, the game is pretty entertaining in gameplay. The quests, while the standard, go gather x amount of this, talk to someone, find this, find that, can be rather interesting and entertaining enough. Crafting, while I'm not a big fan of it, plays a major role in you getting the best gear, weapons, etc. Furthermore, the community is so friendly that they'd simply all agree to craft you whatever item(s) you need/wanted. So it is possible to rank up your crafts at a relaxing pace.Classes: Its the usual class system that we've seen in all the other MMOs before:Heavy armoured, melee damage inflicting warriors, the OPed archers, the annoying healing Priests, and of course the-middle-of-all-the-classes, the wizard, who is a rather interesting class.The game is also not p2w at all. There are ways to get market items for free in drops and your daily Lucky Cards. The gear that takes real money, is simply for looks. It shows it comes with no new moves, attacks, or ratings to suggest buying one would give yourself an advantage in battle.Storage is a problem, but it is so much better than other MMOs, especially SWTOR and Eldevin. There are literally, 28 vaults you can rent, 3 more bags, and storage conatiners you can share with your other characters. Ultimately, without getting to the end of the game, I can tell you who the final boss will be. No darklord, no emperor, no stone lord, no evil wizard, witches, dark knights, or anything. Storage will be the final boss. The game should be called Storage Wars, as given enough time, it'll cause you tons of problems. So storage is a big time problem, but the storage you start out with, as well as the free vault, will give you a great start. The rest is for once you travel deep into the game. Something I would like to see added to the game:Mini games. Somethin to do to pass a few minutes, earn a few coins, and maybe play against another player, like checkers, chess, duel etc. The games could be simple like, memory, side-scrolling and other such little things, VnH themed! It'd certainly help the game. I'd even be satisfied with that to count as PvP. Now, for the negatives. I'll list them, then explain. As you'll clearly see, this game is lacking majorly in some content that has become the standard in MMOs:1.No mounts.2. No PvP.Yep thats right. No mounts. Now, it wouldn't be such a big deal to me. I could make do without a horse to ride around on. Majorly dissapointed, yes. But not detrimental to the game. Now, why people couldn't raise aniamals to ride around on, like horses for example, it would fit in PERFECTLY with the game setting. Ultimately, the game is split into two halves: 50% deals with farming, gathering, and just being a neighbor.The other 50% deals with setting off on adventure to kill Ai monsters. So, raising a colt to a full grown horse wouldn't just make sense, it would only add to the game's depth, adding to the theme of the community working together to build a world, making it more interesting all around! Even Eldevin, who's mechanics, and graphics are much older than this game, has a VARIETY of mounts as well as also being set in a medieval world.Next, the PvP. Players love dueling it out on the internet. PvP arenas/ zones/ servers can be found just about anywhere on an online-themed game. So why not here? To keep the the community happy, they say. Well ok, I can try to deal with that. I understand that part. Sadly, it has kept me away from really jumping into the game, wanting to spending money, etc. on it. No pressure Mad Otter. Personally, I think that the lack of PvP is really what has also kept this game from becoming something bigger and being able to compete in the MMO market against the giants of the internet.Finally we have reached the Big One. Housing. Ok, at character creation (best creation I ever went through on a game!)So at creation, they ask for your house design. They list a few different styles for the outside of your house look. And, once you reach the capital city, right inside, is a guy named Donald. Who is, apparently, in love with the fact that players can own a house. He gives you a quest to go to any village and talk to his sister. The reward: one title to own a house! For free! You must simply choose the when and where! Exciting, isn't it?So, after settling down on a spot, I buy my house. First thing you'll see is, that there are DOZENS of outside decoration looks, but they cost real money. No matter though, its just whats on the inside, right?Long story short, there is no housing. All that hubbub about how wonderful they are? Apparently being able to have an extra vault, with access to all your storage areas, is something wonderful everyone should have!Scam of the game, I call it.There is talk they'll add interior housing to the game, but no immediate plans of when and it dont sound like the devs are even working on it as of 11/21/15.Final con: The moderators. Long story short, they're pretty much the refferee of the chat. Sounds good, right? Well, apparently, they feel(or have been told) that when there is one or more players who're fighting in chat for whatever, they can threaten and ban, those players from using the chat for a set period of time. Naturally, for veteran players, this would be a serious penalty. For new players, it'd simply drive 'em away from the game. Just my two cents on that matter. To wrap it up: I'm still not sure how long term I'm gonna be on this MMO. With the lack of any sort of PvP, mounts, and housing, my interest fades quickly.Beyond that, the game is still nice, nostaglic, DEFINITELY NOT p2w. Some of these p2w reviews feel like a free game means no cash shop and when they see one, its "p2w" in their minds. Lol. I will at least keep playing off and on, seeing if the game improves. But for how long, I cannot say. If another MMO appears to have just what I want, then most likely, its bye bye Villagers and Heroes.

content:
Posted: August 6, 2014
												This game has a neat crafting system. It's so incredibly easy to excel. However, when you buy a house in a village you must CONSTANTLY pay rent or else the house will disappear without warning or any way to recover said house. This includes any farming you had done or ranching. I lost everything I was working on in a 2 week span. Most other games give you notice and you pay rent for months. NOT weeks like this game. I mioght recommend this game for a young kid because of the bright colors and easy game play etc, but for the regular gamer I would say no.

content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												This game needs help, it started as a facebook game and it is not much better then that. The graphics are cartoonish but that is an art choice, yet it requires a powerful computer to run smoothly on high "detail". Now this game is not for combat, it is about the crafting as it is fairly well fleshed out and wasy to understand. Yet the developers found out about this and placed a stopper on crafting, assuming to stop botting but all it has done is harm the actual player. This is due to the ease of creating other accounts who have no restriction on creating potions to remove this blockade put down by the devs.Next the lag in this game is atrocious there is alot of skipping, getting stuck in objects and being hit by enemies that are no where near you (this is also tied into the "combat" of the game). I did some research and this lag has something to do with the old code from this games facebook days, but this brings up the games combat system, or lack there off. It appears as a turn based combat system at first however it is real time, its just missing all forms of depth and complexity. All you do is spam combat arts and spells with the occasional auto attack and things die, but each attack has an animation and once the animation is begun it is a guaranteed hit unless a dodge is performed. Except no enemy dodges attacks only players.This leads to my playthrough being a hammer fest of the number keys and then spamming the z key when it got too much, but that is also down to RNG it appears as i died many times during a roll. Next up is stats of the character, health and spirit restore way to slow. 40 points a minute out of combat is atrocious, this leads to players waiting for a half hour at higher levels waiting doing nothing, there are potions however yet I can only find them in the pay money to the dev section. Death is meaningless, except for the part where you do less damage and take more for 10 minutes meaning you have to wait (or pay the dev). Now leveling, i was going to beat the game until I spent about 10 hours grinding exp in an area my level only to find my total exp went up 5%. I had to check my numbers but it is about that, the requirements go up exponentially without the gained exp going up a decent amount. So now i have to wait to partake in laggy boring combat that is worth nothing... so glad i can craft oh wait my bot accounts haven't finished. I gave up and went back to EvE online as it is more excitingSo we have a crafting game that makes you pay to keep crafting or exploit a bottable set of commands, horrid lag, bare bones combat, long waiting between battles and death unless your a healer with a level up system designed by morons. This game needs to be pulled down, decompiled and remade by competent game developers who have some idea how to make interesting combat, better netcode, proper leveling system and better anti bot measures then just breaking the part of the game that is worth a damn.2/10 Not worth the time really, only play if you have so much time on your hands after watching paint dry for an hour

content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												This game literally gave my computer cancer, the only redeeming factor was ease of uninstallation thanks to steam's convenient interface, I started playing and was immediately accosted by graphics that wouldn't have passed muster on the n64,  some of the worst character designs I've ever seen in a game, and music so mindlessly average they would have been better served to have simply left it out. In spite of all of this I decided to roll a character and play for a while, that was an aweful, aweful mistake. I would like the time I spent playing this back, everything from questing to skills, to combat, to professions was so disgustingly below average I thought I was playing something coded by the makers of Runescape, If 5 monkey coded for 5 years on 5 computers you would have villagers and heroes. Once, the pope downloaded villagers and heroes, played it, and declared satan the clear winner at reality. If you're thinking of downloading this, a glass of bleach may be preferable for an evening's entertainment. Now if you'll excuse me I'm off to set this hard drive on fire to erase the shame of having ever downloaded this.

content:
Posted: January 28, 2015
												A FUN ALPHA BUILD!! (many bad programing errors and feutures that are not polished yet)I played this game today with my wife for some fun, to enjoy a nice MMORPG. At first look it is great tones of stuff to do, open world style mmo (you dont have to do anything more than the tutorial to do things) and it was quite fun for the first hour.I encounted many issues, mainly with programing. The game works but there is many "Hacks" in the program, that can and will be exploited if not fixed. (Hack as in a way to program something in, not the right way leaving it open to be exploited, not expecting it to be exploited). It also casues load issues and in some cases can cause system to crash.The tutorial needs to be worked on and as it sits it is great, it just does not explain "Everything" as in expecting your players to read your tutorial that is longer than 2 sentences is not going to work. They wont, they want to play and you are only wasteing time putting it there.For the remainder of my time I spent it seeing how much you can troll newbs, and there is alot of trollability. Step one grab a auto clicker. Step 2 find a place where a newb is trying to gather stuff. step three point curser at resource. step four activate auto clicker. number of helpful: 5 of 13 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2014
												This is a usual MMO RPG, though this one appears to be a bit low-badget. I don't mind the graphics and I can deal with the unoriginal quests, but I couldn't deal with constant lag and the weird character movement. I didn't compare it with major games like World Of Warcraft but I have tried a lot F2P MMO RPG and I can honestly say there are better than this out there.It has plenty of professions to lvl up and the skills are obtained by items, the items you craft and combine. This is a good twist on the lvl up to obtain the new skill model. The talent tree lacks a bit though, not much to do there. The combat is the basic shortcut but....less. The skill "manifestation" is lacking to a point that auto-attack might be more desirable to the eye.This might happened to me only (maybe my screen settings) but at night (in game) it was too dark. Raising the brightness (in game) distorted the colors of the brighted places and raising the brightness of my monitor was blinding me when the day came. Maybe they wanted to give the real night impression like some other games to prevent to hunt at night easily but waiting for the sun to come up was adding to the lack of interest.I didn't play much so I cannot say about end game or even how it progresses, but it is a game that couldn't make me wanna hit the launch button again.  I do not hate it, it was not bad, but I didn't like it either. I believe the word "average" is what best describes it.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												This is a very dull game. Once you hit level 16 in any crafting skill there will be a brick wall that blocks your progression. This is valled "Vim." It's like stamina or energy. You can only craft or gather a certain amount of times before you've run out and must wait or buy potions from the cash shop to refill it. I would not recommend this game, mainly because crafting is all it really has going for itself and even that feels like a grind.As for the combat it's super basic. Not even worth mentioning.

												Another review by Gaius Julius CaesarI have found that this game is a enjoyable game with lots of people who seem to play it and enjoy it. This is different for me however, I find the lag to be allmost murderous, I, at times, thought I would die before the game did what I asked, if I said for the character to move to a different spot it would take many seconds before it even started to move. Loading is okay but the moving around the map is pathetic.I still do tyr to put up with this game but i do not go on it much, as it requires a lot of patience to use. Patience is not a thing you will find in me when it comes with games like this. So if you have a high patience level then I would say you might want to get this game, but if you don't then do not get this game, you might hate yourself if you do. Also, the music was not original, I recognized the song from when I played in band in high school. I was also disappointed to discover that the Gnomented items are soulbound.In conclusion, I will not be buying a faerie pack.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
												Playing Villagers and Heroes was a terrible experience. Im not going to talk about the ugly graphics or the bugs and glitches that sometime can be very annoying, or the server lag, that even in a half empty EU server can be an issue. Im going to talk about the bad game design:  There is no looting system, yeah right, NO LOOTING SYSTEM, party loot is ALWAYS FREE FOR ALL, imagine how that can work well in a mmorpg. Quests are the worst designed quests I ever seen, and I did play a lot of games. Tedious as hell, and often barely give you hints about what to do. Crafting looks deep at first, but it is quite boring and a very huge money sink, and the ton of different crafting mats will fill up your storage very fast, forcing you to buy space with real money, or throw stuff away. Spirit regeneration, mana-like power bar that is used by all classes (4) to use skills, is a big pain in the butt, you are probably meant to craft huge stacks of potions, because there is no food or /sit option to bring that regen up. You just stand around watching it ticking up veeery slowly all 3-4 mobs. Someone said it gets better when you level up but no idea how much better it would be. I really wanted to try it for the crafting that looked interesting, but as I seen that leveling it up burns tons of money, making you probably have to grind money for that, I stopped trying.
