content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												I have played a lot of games, and I mean a lot. Mostly MMO's in fact. I have never seen one so undiverse,  with no depth, and riddled with bugs as this one.	To start off, you are placed in some Hollow place, where you have to kill wolves for a lady (which might I add may be difficult), this is the start of a almost 1 1/2 hour tutorial where you do unuseful things, such as gather wood, just so you can walk over five feet and make a bow that you proceed to take to some guy and he gives you a better one, thus making the bow you spend ten minutes on useless. You can learn to cook, or brew alcoholic beverages, by shaking a tree and a few button clicks. The tutorial is long, basic, uninteresting a crueling and teaches you absolutely nothing useful about the actual game.	Let's talk a little more about the crafting. While the crafting is much like Guild Wars 2's "Click, UI pops up, click on what you want, some time passes, item pops out" it is actually very immersive in the fact that your crafting is nearly unlimited. It goes to a very high point and you can basically craft any weapon, armor or anything else you want if you have the materials		Characters. This just makes me angry beyond all recognition. It should make you angry . A priest, hunter, warrior and mage. REALLY. You couldn't have at least tried to come up with one ORIGINAL class. It's really not that hard. Just make a hunter with a special twist, but NOOOOOOO, no originality in this game. There is nothing original about any of the classes, they do the same thing that they do in every game. To add to the unoriginal characters, they have their own "Talents" where you put your points when you level up. There is only around 12 places to actually put your talent points. Then you just keep putting them into the same ones, "upgrading" the talent.	While the talents are not abundent, the skills are. Woodcutting, Plant lore, and fishing are just a couple. They all have unique perks and as you level up you get "Achievements" which gies you some in game money to spend. This is useful not only from a money standpoint, but also from a resource standpoint, you don't just grind mobs for money. Sadly, the fish are just recolors of another fish for the most part.	Combat. Combat is a copy paste of WoW, just like the rest of this game. You click, and your character auto-attacks, you can use your 1-0 keys to aid with your various skills that unlock over time. Combat is nothing special, and pretty bland. Once you kill an enemy, your loot flys fifty feet into the air and spews all over the place. Annoying. And if you help someone kill another monster, and you aren't in the same party, then you might not get the loot. To top it all off, all the quests are "Go kill X amount of _____ animal. Come back to me when you did it." it's just a "grind" to the death.	Let's talk about graphics & UI. The graphics aren't that great, after all this is 2014. THis game honestly looks like the old Spyro games. I went to add my friend to the friends list (if they had one, I didn't know if they did). I searched the menu until I found the friends list, only to find that there is no search. You have to go and FIND your friend in order to add them. When you find them they have to hold still so you can "inspect" them and then move to the top of the screen to add them. It's a bother.	Quests. I have gone briefly over quests in the tutorial section of this segment, BUT let me elaborate. The main questline is hardly thrown together. Side quests are repetitive, and even some of them DON'T EVEN WORK. You can't comeplete some of the quests. Not once have I ever seen an MMO where you can't complete a quest. Sometimes you can't even talk to the person who gave you the quest in the first place.	Glitches. They are like your BFF in this game. There are too many. Everywhere you look you may get stuck in a building or fall through the map or something else that should not happen. As previously mentioned you might not be able to speak to the person you need to either.	Map. The map is not open, it's just a bunch of miniscule, pre-defined maps, with pre-defined spawns. In order to go to another part of the world you go to some teleporter that isn't explained at all and is kind of just there. It's not open or free at all. You feel confined to a small space in every map.	Cliche. There is a central city with all the merchants and teleporters to a whole bunch of different parts of the map. That is so cliche of MMO's I can't describe how angry that makes me. With the teleporters there is also lag as it genereates, so that is useless. Now let's take a nice little look at my personal ratings of this game.Graphics- 2.5, welcome to the 1990's where there were no graphics but boxes. Oh, and fake looking huts. Story- 3, Thrown together by a three year old, I see no connections whatsoever to each character you go to other than where they live Gameplay- 1, This game is so broken it is no fun to play Mechanics- 3, It is playable, but it looks as if it should not be released, almost like it is early ALPHA. The controls are clunky and finicky. Replay Value- 0, don't even bother to play it.Soundtrack- 9, THE ONE THING THAT IS GOOD!! They have a nice soundtrack, suits the towns.Overall: 3, This game isn't worth the time. It was so terrible I couldn't bear to play it the full 5 hours I promise to do before a review. STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME!

												I dont have a lot of hours in this game but those hours I do have, I got all of them in one week of play the first week it came out. number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
												I tried this game in response to a giveaway of one of the content packs and was pleasantly surprised. I find the graphical style rather charming, cartoonish yet reflecting higher resolution GPUs. I concur with many about the crafting system having plenty of depth, though you should probably get some more inventory slots in order to get the most out of it. I have only played the Swift Warrior class so far, which didn't get very high level wise because I was out leveling my crafting and gathering skills. And man, did I enjoy fishing. My only complaint in the four hours of gameplay is that crafting/gathering items from skill use are automatically picked up but players have to manually pick up items gathered from killing monsters, and these items can fall in areas no seen by players. I looked in the settings but didn't see an option to automatically pick up loot. This option would cut down on the time spent twirling about and searching for that treasure. #featurerequest

number of helpful: 1 of 7 people (14%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 21, 2014
												A free slow paced MMO based on simple gameplay and horrible combat.The movement in this game is very sloppy, making you almost laugh at the sliding of players around you. The combat system is also slow and not very fluent, if you move at all, hit a skill by accident or practically do anything while auto attacking, you will completely stop what your doing and the abilities you tried to use will go on cooldown. I can't see how that is viable at any point in the game.Okay then, I get it. The game is called VILLAGERS and heroes, maybe the crafting and exploration part of the game was what it was all about.. but that was not the case. Finding the materials is very easy and when you go to craft items, the game basically does everything for you. You can walk several feet in a village, gather the items needed to cook/fish/shear/whatever and then go back to the area, pick what you want to make and then sit back and watch your guy do every for you. How is that fun? I was hoping a minigame or something interesting to do while cooking or say you had to hammer weapons or armour at a blacksmith? wouldn't that be more fun than watching your pixels stir a pot of apples?So at this point in the game, the combat is sluggish and outdated, the movement is awkward, the quests and zones are way to linear and the crafting/socialization of the game is completely simple and dead. I really don't understand what the appeal is.A and D turning should of been improved, and when you look at players moving, they tend to slide due to sluggish movement design. I've asked several people in game and they feel the same way.And why are the quest givers speaking in atleast 3 different languages when I am set to english?I understand its in beta, but I fail to understand why i'm being spoken to in english, russian and german.This game is still in its early beta, so these things could be fixed and upgraded before it is fully released, but its really hard to endure even an hour of this when you have experienced quality games like World of Warcraft and other MMO's. (Thats not to say its complete garbage, as the forementioned games are subscription based and have time behind their backs to master the this subject of gaming.)The small player base, having only several players in any given area, makes the chat dead and empty, accept for the occasional moderator snooping around, dropping filter hammers on your head.On that note, I said "crap" in chat, and I was told to not use curse words or I should leave the game. Clearly, this game is highly censored, which is a huge turn off for me. I do however, like the art design very much, a nice casual blend of sharp detail and a nice mesh of colours makes it looks very pretty.Character design is very primitive and the players look very ugly. But thats not important.What is important, is the store. It has a large selection of cosmetic items, gag items and unfortunetly has Pay 2 Win, making this dead to me the minute I logged on. (combat potions. bro, those are pay to win)All in all, its just another cheap MMO. Give it a go if your looking for a free game to play or just casually sit around with friends, but don't expect anything special.I also find it odd how recommended reviews are always highly rated up, even when there is no content. It's almost like people can't stand having this substandard game rated down. Anyway, they tried, they failed horribly and now this is another sad pimple on the face of MMO history. Enjoy :PPersonal Rating: 1.5/5

												 Granted, I didn't play this game for more than 10 minutes. I really wanted to enjoy it because the trailers look pretty amazing, but then you realise that the controls are extremely jerky and unrefined. The aestethics of it can be a tad bit weird at times, but that doesn't matter. However, it's the sheer unprofessional look of all of the GUI. It looks as if it belonged to a flash game. Also, for me the NPCs talked in russian for some reason, although the text was in english. But even if you can get past these unpolished aspects, the gameplay and the way it controls just killed it for me.

number of helpful: 1 of 7 people (14%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 19, 2014
												There are a lot of great ideas here, but sadly they are implemented horribly.  Combat is floaty and unresponsive.  Quests are standard run of the mill kill x rats, gather x berries, etc.  Crafting is a boring grind.  The staggering amount of things you have to pay for is insane.  Worst example I saw in the short time I played was in order to queue up crafting jobs (ex: smelt all your copper ore) you have to buy a consumable item.  That lets you craft 10 items at a time, once.  Free to play has such massive potential for great consumer experiences (see Path of Exile), but if developers keep putting in blatant money grabs like this that only hinder gameplay, it will continue to have the terrible reputation that it does.

number of helpful: 5 of 16 people (31%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 17, 2014
												   Wow... where do I start with this? This game... if you can call it one... is... ridiculous. For starters this game lags HEAVILY on my computer, especially because I run TF2 ALOT and it runs beautifully. After tweaking a few graphic problems, another problem came up for me. The amount of characters and customization was just BAD. They were all standard and could've been more creative besides the whole DPS, support, ranged, and healer standard.    I chose the Archer and began in a town overrun by wolves. Now the idea was standard for a beginning point, but the combat, OH THE COMBAT.     The combat in this game is the worst part besides something else we'll get to later. The combat is slow, especially with the Archer. It took me forever to use one attack. Compared to something like DC Universe Online or other MMO's of this rank, the moves from what I saw with the beginning Archer aren't very diverse.    Now I tried some other ones on the downloaded version on the original website and they all were very standard as well. The Fighter or Warrior was slow but not like the Archer, the Mage is a faster and more powerful Archer, and the Cleric is actually the OK class. It's not the worst, but it's better than most of these characters.   Now we got the MAIN aspect that this game has been titling, the crafting, jobs, and house ownership. I hated this with a passion. I enjoy doing crafting and sometimes jobs and I'm a nut with customization, but this didn't appeal to me. The main reason being it was ALL done FOR YOU. I mean common, all it required was for you to go fech some supplies and let the game do it for you. Couldn't we have a minigame, maybe somekind of lore or SOMETHING behind this piece to keep it interesting. After the dissapointment of crafting, I tried jobs, and the same problems occured. So I tried the house ownership, and even THAT was bland.    After all the dissapointment of this bland crafting and customization system, I tried the social. Nobody was talking, except for ONE person who commented on how bad the game was. So I gave up on this mess.   I only found a few redeeming qualities in this game, and it was just how holding these NPCs were to the player. Like, they gave you ALL the information you could possibly need.   Overall, don't waste the space for this "game". Don't buy the DLC, don't do anything. This game failed to immerse me into its world because it failed in about the first few seconds of GAMEPLAY. If you want a real immersive MMO, go get World of Warcraft or especially DC Universe Online, a game I can say granted alongside TF2 is the best F2P games out there. I beg of you, do not get this game. It will be a waste of the 30 minutes you spend in it. TL;DR: The game is a waste of time. The combat and whole "social" experience is horrible and there is little to no customization in the game. The games' immersion is just terrible and fails to grab the attention of most players. The only reedeeming quality was that the game held your hand like a little child. Don't download it, go play TF2 or DC Universe Online or any other better F2P game.

												This is a realy awkward feeling MMO. The controles feel jumpy and the quests are not easy to understand compared with most mmo's today.This game doesn't even come close to other free games we can play today and it's a shame that there are still people putting time and efford in games like this.The first quest for example took me 15min. because if 6 people attack one mob, the person doing the last hit gets the quest kill. How do you expect people to spend 15min. for only the first quest just to kill 3 wolfs.The combat feels weird and slow, there's no good/easy way to compare items or skills.I might be used to other good f2p mmo's / games but because those are out there this game is not going to live long.I recomand to skip this game and search for other f2p mmo's.

number of helpful: 3 of 12 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												I though about giving this game a try, and it's been painful. The first time I tried, it was yesterday. I connected to the only EU server that there was, and after making my character,I couldn't even connect, because it was full. I tried then the next day (today), and got the same luck. Then, a few hours later I tried once again, and finally I got into the game, to see how it was.Dissapointment is pretty much the best word. The graphics look really outdated, like if I was playing a game from the 2000's. You can't also move the characters that well, the controls are kinda bad. Then, add the fact that the servers lag way too much, and that the game is generic, WAY TOO GENERIC. It's like any MMO out there! Or at least what I've saw on the time I've spend on the missions and quest that they give you: Hit trees to get apples, hit trees to get wood, hit rocks to get minerals, hit generic monsters because there are too many.And that's another thing: The monster spawn-rate is horrible. It takes 2 minutes to 4 monsters to spawn, when over 10 people are waiting and trying to kill 4-8 for a quest. It took me 10 minutes to kill 5 skeletons that only took me 5 seconds to annihilate. The rest of the time was spend jumping arround, waiting until they're back, and trying to get the first hit ,so other players don't steal the monsters from me. And I ended up being the prick that steals the monsters because I had enough already.This is even worse than a generic MMO. A game that's been for a while already, that they decide to put on Steam so more people play it, and in the end, ends up making the game even more unplayable. I hope I don't have to see it ever again.

number of helpful: 2 of 10 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												Looking at all the negative reviews i had to see it for myself. I gave this game the benifit of the doubt as i'm an rpg lover and i do not believe graphics should be how a game is judged. Do not bother seriously this game handles worse than runescape. The mouse acceleration is woefully terrible. auto attack is responcive about 1 every 5 clicks. Character models and customisation is lack luster. Only the most forgiving and ignorant players who were able to play total crap should even waste the download space. Simply put this game suffers from not coming out 10 years ago where it may have had more luck in a world where you can get charged for games of much higher quality. 2.5D browser games for free have better content and systems than this game and your money is better aimed elsewhere. These bad reviews are written for a reason we do this to tell you guys not to bother when we see a poor product and inform you of what is good in situations you are undecided. If you read this and want to see for yourself how bad it is I am a person who read negative comments and went to see for myself and now i'm writing this review 20 minutes into your future. Save yourself the time and effort and do not pay these guys any money. they need to learn you get paid for good products in this world not shovel crap.

content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												Let's see; IO played this game for about 34 minutes and right off the bat, I could tell it was unfinished.  The animatiosn seemed stilted and sucky.  But I persevered.  The quests are VERY generic and boring (go here, kill this many things, get this many things, return).  But then I got stuck.  You're supposed to shear sheep to get items to craft a belt.  But shearing the sheep DOES NOTHING!  Like Wonka says, YOU GET NOTHING!  At that point, its either just kill things or quit and being that there's no reason to keep playing if you can't advance farther, I quit.  And then there are the ENORMOUS amout of micro-transactions that are available.  This game just OOZES Facebook game, sadly.  And then you have the issue that the npcs switch between English, German, and Russian greetings!  What, they can't stick to ONE language greeting!?  I would say this game needs more polish, but I don't any amount of polish will save THIS one!  But on the bright side, it's a TINY download and you don't have to make an account.

number of helpful: 0 of 8 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 17, 2014
												People are finding my initial review unhelpful. So i'll re-write it.If you still dislike my review its because you're being a fanboy/fangirl.-----The game had a lot of trouble just getting started. The launcher had to verify files. It took a very long time to load. And when I finally got it, I was greeted with stuttering gameplay. Not lag. The game itself doesn't run smooth. The tutorial really should be optional. Because after they teach you one task, its obvious that generally the same mechanic applies for the rest of the crafting. Combat. Its very clunky. Its very slow. You click a button and almost a full second or 2 later.. Your character reacts. Animations are very stale. The design of the game seems very crowded. The UI is also clunkly. The NPC dialogue window especially.But again.. My biggest problem was the stuttering lag. My computer is no slouch either. I run every game on I own on High with atleast 30 FPS. Usually 40-50. So its not my computer.The entire experience I had with this game was just not fun. It was boring. From the moment I logged in. Until I quit. You could not pay me to play this game.On that note. The game is free. But that doesn't mean you're not wasting your time...

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												(ONLY 5 HOURS IN)The game feels and plays like a hybrid of WoW and other standard piano sim RPGs, Wurm Online, and (don't worry) zynga/loserville.There isn't a true moneygrubbing energy system as far as I can tell.  The game's equivellant (Vim) appears after 16 levels in.  They supposedly did this to make it easier to level, but it feels like the practice of brickwalling to extort money out of players. Fortunatly, it is fast regenning AND there are a ton of items, like foods, that let you regen it faster.Crafting is a two step process, as usual.  Gathering and creating.  You click on a node, which drops an item randomly chosen based on your level and the level of the node, and you pick it up.  There are many types of nodes, at least one for each gathering profession which can be levelled up.  For instance, if you collect 20 copper ore, then take it to an anvil and work it into 20 copper ingots, you can then work those into warrior weapons, armour, or a few special items.  Crafting is a large part of the game, as evident by the fact that you learn how to gather materials 2 minutes after learning how to fight.There are a lot of silly quests, such as freeing a man from his imprisonment in an archery target.  The man tells you you must brave the horrors of Mount Deadly, kill the deadly Hurtsubad, and collect 7 gems from around the world to combine into a staff that has just enough magic to free him from his curse.  When you point out that the archery target seems to resemble a man in a costume a lot, he'll say "I had you going though!!"  This is only a few minutes of this quest, so don't worry too much about spoilers.Every MMO has it's useless and pointless minigame, and this one is no exception.  While other mmos make their pointless minigame crafting, this one actually made crafting worthwhile and fun.  Unfortunatly, to fill the void with something useless, they added a gambling game.  Not poker, or any other card game that would be fun.  No, you play Rock Paper Siccors.  Waste of time and gold coins, dont bother.  Tell you what I'd like to see for a pointless minigame.  Tiddly winks.  Yeah, really!  Don't you want to do the John Lennon Memorial Shot without actually being there?  No?  Oh okay.  Yeah, just joking around, don't add tiddlywinks.  There is apparently instanced villages, as well, which let you own your own house, and lets you stock/create resources through a node system where you collect 20 of something naturally, then put it into a stocking bin and it creates 200 of that item in a harvesting node.  THis can be used to create public copper mines or something similar for your players.After 5 hours of gameplay, I can say I recommend it. This review subject to change.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 9, 2015
												This game is fun, the monsters are cute, and it is well thought out in many ways.  However, there are a few things that make me reluctant to recommend this game to my friends.  The lag makes this game frustrating/unplayable at times.  There is one other small change they could make to keep young players and new players.  In this game you have to craft your hp potions and sp elixers, meaning you have to spend hours gathering materials and crafting pots if you want to be able to play efficiently.  I find it very boring to craft potions and I want to jump right into the fighting action.  The developers could solve this by simply selling hp and sp by npcs so children (whom would never spend hours crafting just so they could play) would stay past the first few lvls.  The game is very fun and I would like to recommend it to my friends that all capped out at our last game, but the lag and tedious crafting of hp/sp pots makes me reluctant.  If they fix these 2 problems the game deserves a huge, loyal following.

Posted: April 26, 2014
												So, I've played 115 minutes up to now, reached level 7. Crashed to desktop 11 times and now stuck on a loading screen when trying to enter a new zone, which by the way the new patch they released was suppose to fix.  Those who haven't tried it out yet, it's worth a shot but if you're crashing to desktop every 5 to 10 minutes I'd wait a few weeks for more patches to be deployed.  I've played countless MMOs since 93 and Villagers and Heroes is a real CTD mess.  If they can fix the stuck loading screen and reduce the CTD by at least 50% , this game is definitely worth a try.

Other than that, fun game. Lots to do.Update: Okay. I came back to this game about a year later. Things seem to be updated. I decided I was just going to go through the main story quest and see how far I can get. Turns out, they've added a lot of pay-to-win ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t into this game since I last played. Combat is ridiculous now. Just a bunch of button mashing that apparently does nothing. You get killed brutally by even low-level creatures. You make the game actually fun first, and then I'll consider spending money in your shop.

content:
Posted: October 27, 2015
												This game is just...ugly. Poor character models, inanely bad landscapes, and laughable enemies make this game visually unappealing. The style begs to be compared to something like Fable, but it doesn't have the same charm.Gameplay-wise, you click an enemy, watch your character bash the enemy into bits, collect loot, rinse and repeat until you get bored as all hell and contemplate on life. Yes, it's dull, at least to me. That and the fact this is supposed to be an MMO, there aren't any other players...kinda see why now.Music is all stock and really forgettable, though I will say that the narrator has an epic voice, that's really the few redeemable qualities of the game.Overall a run-of-the-mill MMORPG with lackluster performance and incredibly uninspired gameplay.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 28, 2016
												I read a lot of comments before deciding to give Villagers and Heroes a try. And I can say, I'm glad I did. Though I've only played about an hour or so I found I really like it. Being an avid MMORPG gamer I was impressed at the games straight forward playing. It took me a bit to get used to things but the more I played the more I settled.  I am glad to have found a game that I didn't feel pressured to have hurry to do this or that. In fact, I really enjoyed just being able to meander around the beginning town at my own pace exploring and getting familiar with things. I can say people who are looking for a laid back, play at your own pace and have an awesome time and happy time playing this game is for you. If you are looking for a heavy PVP or pressured PVE this game is not for you.

												It's not the best mmo, but it's certainly not the worst. The reason im recommending it, is because it's free, so if you don't like it, who cares? You didn't spend any money to get this game. You didn't lose anything, except however much time you put into it. The controls aren't, great, but I've definitely seen worse. The same goes for about everything in this game. Overall, it's average. But it's FREE. I know some people like it, and some people don't. Personally, I enjoyed it, but only because I could play with my friends. I disliked the lack of a thief class, but I didn't care that much about it. I guess I might as well end with, try it out, it's FREE!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												(ONLY 5 HOURS IN)The game feels and plays like a hybrid of WoW and other standard piano sim RPGs, Wurm Online, and (don't worry) zynga/loserville.There isn't a true moneygrubbing energy system as far as I can tell.  The game's equivellant (Vim) appears after 16 levels in.  They supposedly did this to make it easier to level, but it feels like the practice of brickwalling to extort money out of players. Fortunatly, it is fast regenning AND there are a ton of items, like foods, that let you regen it faster.Crafting is a two step process, as usual.  Gathering and creating.  You click on a node, which drops an item randomly chosen based on your level and the level of the node, and you pick it up.  There are many types of nodes, at least one for each gathering profession which can be levelled up.  For instance, if you collect 20 copper ore, then take it to an anvil and work it into 20 copper ingots, you can then work those into warrior weapons, armour, or a few special items.  Crafting is a large part of the game, as evident by the fact that you learn how to gather materials 2 minutes after learning how to fight.There are a lot of silly quests, such as freeing a man from his imprisonment in an archery target.  The man tells you you must brave the horrors of Mount Deadly, kill the deadly Hurtsubad, and collect 7 gems from around the world to combine into a staff that has just enough magic to free him from his curse.  When you point out that the archery target seems to resemble a man in a costume a lot, he'll say "I had you going though!!"  This is only a few minutes of this quest, so don't worry too much about spoilers.Every MMO has it's useless and pointless minigame, and this one is no exception.  While other mmos make their pointless minigame crafting, this one actually made crafting worthwhile and fun.  Unfortunatly, to fill the void with something useless, they added a gambling game.  Not poker, or any other card game that would be fun.  No, you play Rock Paper Siccors.  Waste of time and gold coins, dont bother.  Tell you what I'd like to see for a pointless minigame.  Tiddly winks.  Yeah, really!  Don't you want to do the John Lennon Memorial Shot without actually being there?  No?  Oh okay.  Yeah, just joking around, don't add tiddlywinks.  There is apparently instanced villages, as well, which let you own your own house, and lets you stock/create resources through a node system where you collect 20 of something naturally, then put it into a stocking bin and it creates 200 of that item in a harvesting node.  THis can be used to create public copper mines or something similar for your players.After 5 hours of gameplay, I can say I recommend it. This review subject to change.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
												Haven't played for too long and for that, I'll keep it short.When I started the game I went through pretty generic customization meaning I could only change the face, hair, and a few other things to only the characters head. Things that I could change only had a few options to change (in other words, customization is pretty bland and you WILL see other players who look exactly like you).Oh well, the customization to your characters head shouldn't make or break the game, right?Next, I loaded into the starters area where I went through a pretty dull intro to the game mechanics. This time it was a pack of wolves or felcats or something of that nature annoying the villagers (never seen that before). On a side note, this game DOES run smoothly on the worst of computers (I know first hand). So if you cant play other graphically-intensive games out there, then this is for you.Oh well, it's the tutorial. Of course it's going to be boring just like in (most) other mmo's.Now, I know it's not sounding too hot as of now, but after the tutorial I encountered the communtity of the game. I was very pleased with my discovery. Once I began moving out of the starting area, I was met by some experienced players. They helped me complete quests, find hidden areas, and explained game mechanics which were way overwhelming to a starter at first (as in EIGHT different classes of crafting each with thier own experience levels, yikes!). Once those eight crafting classes were explained, what could've been a down had now turned into a complete positive! Eight different ways to play created many different play-styles along with new things to do.Now, I know I probably missed tons of things, so heres a quick list of Pros and Cons (not in order of importance).Pros:                                                                            Cons:-Runs well on the worst of computers                         -Bland customization-Friendly and helpful community                                 -Boring tutorial-Lots of variation to play styles                                    -Crafting can be overwhelming at first-Eight different forms of crafting                                -Combat is dull (click to attack along with 1,2,3,4,5,6,etc. for spells)-Simple and easy to play                                             -Storyline is a little underwhelming-Appealing to new players-Free-NOT PAY TO WINThanks, for reading! Keep in mind I'm still pretty new to the game so I might be updating the review as I progress. Also, I think this is my first review so sorry if the format was wierd. I definately recommend this game, plus it's free. If for whatever reason you dislike the game, you won't be wasting your money and it's as easy as pressing uninstall to move on.

content:
Posted: October 27, 2015
												This game is just...ugly. Poor character models, inanely bad landscapes, and laughable enemies make this game visually unappealing. The style begs to be compared to something like Fable, but it doesn't have the same charm.Gameplay-wise, you click an enemy, watch your character bash the enemy into bits, collect loot, rinse and repeat until you get bored as all hell and contemplate on life. Yes, it's dull, at least to me. That and the fact this is supposed to be an MMO, there aren't any other players...kinda see why now.Music is all stock and really forgettable, though I will say that the narrator has an epic voice, that's really the few redeemable qualities of the game.Overall a run-of-the-mill MMORPG with lackluster performance and incredibly uninspired gameplay.

content:
Posted: January 26, 2016
												The most unfortunate thing about this game is that it lags a lot, and there are several bugs in the game that cause you to not be able to interact with npc's, or crafting stations.  If you can deal with having to close out the game and relogging all the time then I guess go for it.  The most positive thing about the game is the community, this is a rare community in the MMO world that are actually not jerks.  The graphics are meh, but playable.  I was not that impressed, esp not enough to give any real $ to it, but you decide.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												I played for a couple hours to give it a try. Pros:-Fun character creation and storyline-Easy character advancement (not a big talent tree to follow like some games)-Lot's of crafting.-No pvp (this is a con for some people)Cons:-Graphics like everyone says. They are on the lines of WoW, but worse.-Buggy (lots of times a lagged out or had to get in the right spot to click something)Now I only played this game until I got all my crafting to level 10 and my warrior to level 8. So  I didn't give it a big massive chance. My first impression was I was pretty happy with the game. It had everything I like. But I started running into the buggyness and even though I don't need AAA graphics, I would at least like modern.The world is kind of barren also in the start. I don't know if it gets better, but the start area seems to have alot of just farms that have no real use. The gathering seems to be done in specific areas which is boring also. open world gathering is more interesting. I could have really stuck with this game, but it's lacking as a full MMO. It is perfect for a casual person or child though.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 9, 2015
												This game is fun, the monsters are cute, and it is well thought out in many ways.  However, there are a few things that make me reluctant to recommend this game to my friends.  The lag makes this game frustrating/unplayable at times.  There is one other small change they could make to keep young players and new players.  In this game you have to craft your hp potions and sp elixers, meaning you have to spend hours gathering materials and crafting pots if you want to be able to play efficiently.  I find it very boring to craft potions and I want to jump right into the fighting action.  The developers could solve this by simply selling hp and sp by npcs so children (whom would never spend hours crafting just so they could play) would stay past the first few lvls.  The game is very fun and I would like to recommend it to my friends that all capped out at our last game, but the lag and tedious crafting of hp/sp pots makes me reluctant.  If they fix these 2 problems the game deserves a huge, loyal following.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2014
												After they took out the Vim system, the developers attempted to revamp this game. I found that it was plagued with bugs and glitches; so much so that it wasn't playable. i could barely get past the loading screen, and when i did the fps was terrible and the game would continuously crash. I was very dissappointed. I am happy to say, now though, that after YEARS of tinkering and tweaking, they seem to have gotten it right. The game is stable, and a very fun time waster to boot. There's fighting, crafting, farming, events and even a modest gaming community that is very enthusiastic about its' baby. It's taken a long time, but i think this is finally a game to be proud to play.
